Article page

This article page shows you HTML elements commonly used in a web page. Generic MAKEITSO base styles are applied. For instance this one: the introduction paragraph style for a slightly bigger introduction text.
Missing one?... let me know! See all other examples below.

These basic styles are useful as a base reference or startingpoint for your project.

Paragraph

This is a paragraph. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Itaque hic ipse iam pridem est reiectus; Superiores tres erant, quae esse possent, quarum est una sola defensa, eaque vehementer. Re mihi non aeque satisfacit, et quidem locis pluribus. Duo Reges: constructio interrete.

Example HTML elements

1st level heading h1 or .alpha

2nd level heading h2 or .beta

3rd level heading h3 or .gamma

4th level heading h4 or .delta

5th level heading h5 or .epsilon

Basic paragraph to follow heading

HMTL Lists

Unordered list

  • One.
  • Two.
  • Three. Note that for short items lists look better if they are compactly presented, whereas for long items, it would be better to have more vertical spacing between items.
  • Four. This is the last item in this list.

Ordered list

  1. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Cur deinde Metrodori liberos commendas? Quarum ambarum rerum cum medicinam pollicetur
  2. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Cur deinde Metrodori liberos commendas? Quarum ambarum rerum cum medicinam pollicetur
  3. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Cur deinde Metrodori liberos commendas? Quarum ambarum rerum cum medicinam pollicetur
  4. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Cur deinde Metrodori liberos commendas? Quarum ambarum rerum cum medicinam pollicetur
  5. Lorem ipsum dolor sit amet, consectetur adipiscing elit. Cur deinde Metrodori liberos commendas? Quarum ambarum rerum cum medicinam pollicetur

Textual elements

  • Bold look text
  • Emphasized text
  • Italic text
  • Strong text
  • Marked text

  • Subscripts and superscripts (sub and sup markup).
    Lorem ipsum dolor 1 and H2O (where subscripts occur).

    Superscripts: Mlle, 1st, and then some mathematical notations: ex, sin2 x, and some nested superscripts (exponents) too: ex2 and f(x)g(x)a+b+c (where 2 and a+b+c should appear as exponents of exponents).

Buttons

  • button

  • button
For 50 years, WWF has been protecting the future of nature. The world's leading conservation organization, WWF works in 100 countries and is supported by 1.2 million members in the United States and close to 5 million globally.

Tables

Sample table: Areas of the Nordic countries, in sq km
Country Total area Land area
Denmark 43,070 42,370
Finland 337,030 305,470
Iceland 103,000 100,250
Norway 324,220 307,860
Sweden 449,964 410,928

An embedded video

Wrap an embedded video in a div with class video. J. Picard: Make it so!

Characters tests

Char. Explanation Notes
ê e with circumflex Latin 1 character, should be ok
— em dash Windows Latin 1 character, should be ok, too
Ā A with macron (line above) Latin Extended-A character, not present in all fonts
Ω capital omega A Greek letter
− minus sign Unicode minus
⌀ diameter sign relatively rare in fonts

Feedback/information boxes

Common UI usecase where feedback is given by the backend. Use a div with a class of ui-info

A p wrapped in a div with class .ui-info

A p wrapped in a div with class .ui-info .ui-info_information

A p wrapped in a div with class .ui-info .ui-info_warning

A p wrapped in a div with class .ui-info .ui-info_error

A p wrapped in a div with class .ui-info .ui-info_success

Grid with floated elements examples

Examples of how to create a grid for (a piece of) content. You can find these example selectors in the _theme.scss SASS partial file.
